meanings.definition: A task or piece of work assigned to someone as part of their job or course of study.
meanings.sent1: She completed her assignments on time.
meanings.sent2: The teacher gave out new assignments every week.
meanings.sent3: The assignments piled up like a mountain on her desk.
meanings.sent4: His assignments were like puzzle pieces that needed to be put together.
meanings.sent5: The assignments were like little challenges waiting to be conquered.

meanings.definition: The allocation of a job or task to someone.
meanings.sent1: The manager made the assignments for the team.
meanings.sent2: The assignments were divided equally among the group.
meanings.sent3: The assignments seemed to jump from person to person like a game of hot potato.
meanings.sent4: The assignments were like precious gifts handed out to each team member.
meanings.sent5: The assignments were like keys that unlocked different opportunities for growth.

meanings.definition: The transfer of legal rights or property to another person.
meanings.sent1: The lawyer handled the assignments of property smoothly.
meanings.sent2: The assignments of ownership were clearly outlined in the contract.
meanings.sent3: The assignments of rights felt like passing a baton in a relay race.
meanings.sent4: The assignments of legal rights were like trading cards in a game.
meanings.sent5: The assignments of property were like moving pieces on a chessboard.
